poi.name: Avalon
poi.desc: The Avalon System contians the homeeorld of the Avarians, Avalon. Here can be found the seat of government for the whole Avarian Empire, as well as many thriving cities, centers of trade and culture.

poi.name: Westeress
poi.desc: Data Not Avalable

poi.name: Argile
poi.desc: The Argile system is home to the great kingdom of Argile, one of the five core worlds. It is widely regarded as the buisness center of the empire.

poi.name: Utopos
poi.desc: A miserable system, best to move on. Be wary of Utopos, the planet, for it is hard to leave. One of the core worlds, Utopos is under a socalist government, and is the poorest planet in the empire, with the worst living conditions.

poi.name: Atlantis
poi.desc: One of the five core systems, the Atlantis system is home to the planet Atlantis, its moon Malvaston, the planet Zalapa, and the great ship factory of Harbanger. Known for being a center of the arts, the planet of Atlantis is considered to be the most beautiful planet, and has some of the highest prices for land anywhere in the Empire.

poi.name: Ettenweil
poi.desc: Home to two inhabitable planets, the Ettenweil system is part of the outer Empire, but essential for the common food and mechnaical products used by every citizen. The planet of Ettenweil is one of the largest areas of mining and manufacturing, due to it having no real ecology to destroy. On the other hand, the planet of Iuvernia is the largest breadbasket of the Empire. It is home to not just Avarians, but also many Humans of Irish decent, having arrived as refugees from Terra long ago. Now, they are one of the most integrated dual-species societies.

poi.name: Korvan
poi.desc:
Go to the Korvan System at your own risk. We at the Imperial Mapping Department will not accept any blame, in whole or in part, form anything the hapless traveler may experience when traveling to the Korvan System. 
 As far as the planets of the system go, there is Korvan, where all mithril is mined, and there is Revel, the prison of the Celestials. Oh, and don't forget the many thousands of nasty Greek pirates that make this system their home.

poi.name: Tel-Avan
poi.desc: Home system of the Telwar, a noble, yet secrative race. The planet of Tel-Avan is tecnically not part of the Empire, but an agreement stands, allowing it to be within the Empire's infuence, but not direct government. There is also the uninhabited icy persudoplanet Appalos.

poi.name: Noctis
poi.desc: Home system of the Gnomes, Noctis hosts two magnificant planets. THe first is Galvon, hoemworld of the Gnomes. This planet is known for being unpredictable, due to a disaster that unlicensed and unsupervised Gnomish scientists performed, the curon field around the planet is wildly unstable, often resulting in unexpected changes in physical behavior, including spontanious energy exitation or teleportataion. This makes all maps out of date within half an hour of them being first measured. Midnight, the moon of a hot gas giant, is also habitable, even though it is always in the dark. It has a continuous, flamboyant nightlife, full of bars and taverans.

poi.name: Terra
poi.desc: Containing the planet Terra, this system is the origin of all humans. It is not their homeowrld, as they somehow 'teleport' to Terra without any means of prediction or expecting it. As of a very recent event, there have been three distinc stages of teleportation: first the Greeks, then later the Irish, then recently a group calling themselves 'Japaneese'.

poi.name: Halcion Cluster
poi.desc: A set of three stars with independant planetary rings, the Halcion Cluster is the most important colony area in the Empire. Planets include Meridia, Torson, Vectel, Talpos, Omeria, Nimradan, and Galvanta. If one is looking for somewhere to say, head to Torson, as it has actual cities.

poi.name: Swanheil
poi.desc: Home system of the Marmori race, Swanheil is part of the empire, but no one but the Marmori live there. Since Avarians cannot live easily underwater, the Marmori are left to their own devices.

poi.name: Trupidia
poi.desc: Data Not Avalable

poi.name: Hathendrome
poi.desc: The Hathendrome system has many inhabitable planets, and is the home system of the Haflings.

poi.name: Oveath
poi.desc: Data Not Avalable

poi.name: Torilia
poi.desc: Data Not Avalable

poi.name: Anthem
poi.desc: With three inhabited planets, this system has a grand total population over 65 billion, the largest in the Empire, even if the individual planets are not quite. All industries are common here, it is a center of buisness and trade. The three planets are Anthem, Tyrion, and Phalantis, and all are deserving of a visit. See the Golden Palace of Urbanbu on Phalantis, or land at the Dullian Spaceport of Tyrion.

poi.name: Sparta
poi.desc: Home of the Spartan race, this planet has been the forefront of the cold war with the Grenier for many decades.

poi.name: Corilary Minor
poi.desc: Data Not Avalable

poi.name: Corilary Major
poi.desc: Data Not Avalable

poi.name: Veridis
poi.desc: Data Not Avalable

poi.name: Harmony
poi.desc: Data Not Avalable
